name: heat transport fluid system construction, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | heat transport fluid system, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18631/documentation

This activity represents the construction of the heat transport system for a 50 MW solar thermal parabolic trough power plant in Upington, South Africa. The used fluid is a synthetic oil as an eutectic mixture of 73.5% diphenyl oxide and 26.5% biphenyl. This mixture is used since it has a high temperature withstanding capacity. The pressure vessels and heat exchangers are designed to suit the criteria of "Therminol VP-1", one of the products representing this mixture. Apart from that the main components are pumps, compressor, insulation and electrical and concrete and paint. ;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

This activity  begins when the thermal heat storage systems become operational. The heat transport fluid functions between the hot and cold storage tanks with a precise amount of temperature difference being regulated by tap water. 

The activity concludes with the decomissioning of the heat transport fluid system construction setup. The inert materials used as heat transfer fluid are then sent for landfill as a final disposal measure.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The CSP plant represented in this dataset has been modelled specifically for South African conditions (see Telsnig 2015).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Heat Transport Fluid Expansion Vessels Horizontal, Nitrogen storage vessels - cylindrical, 12 ft.diameter, 59 ft.long; 0.52 in.shell and head thickness, 68,000 lb, carbon steel;Expansion Vessel Nitrogen Ullage Gas Compressor; 1300 lb m/hr, 43000ft total developed head, 40 bhp; 75 psia inlet /175 psia outlet pressures, 28 actual ft3/ min discharge flow; 2 stage with intercooler, variable speed drive;;Heat Transport Fluid; Solutia Therminol VP - 1, 0.614 gal/m2 collector field area ;Basic data of Therminal VP-1: ;Melting point: 12°C;Density (300°C): 815 kg/m3;Viscosity (300°C): 0.22 mPa.s;Specific heat capacity (300°C): 2319 J/kg.K;Composition in weight%: 73.5% Diphenyl oxide + 26.5% biphenyl
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The original data modelling a 250 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 50 MW plant design.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 50 MW parabolic trough power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.

exchanges.description: Reference product unit of a heat transport fluid system for 50 MW solar thermal parabolic trough plant.

exchanges.description: The amount of tap water input stems from the water consumption reported in the EPDs of the modelled pumps (Sulzer EPDs). It is stated in the EPDs that the water is used for testing purposes. Therefore, it is assumed to be discharged to the sewer system without pollution. Sulzer EPDs: https://www.sulzer.com/en/shared/about-us/2017/08/10/13/22/environmental-product-declarations (accessed May 2019)

All steel types are assumed to be treated as reinforcing steel due to lack of other appropriate datasets in ecoinvent.  
For the time period 2003-2012, average steel recycling rate in South Africa amounted to 35% fo the total steel mass according to Telsnig 2015. The remaining steel is assumed to be sent to final disposal.
